file_insights.test/load/types.ts: Contains TypeScript interfaces for load test scenarios, configuration, results, and metrics. Defines type-safe data structures for performance testing.
file_insights.test/load/scenarios.ts: Factory functions generating 7 different test scenarios: smoke tests, validation tests, constant load (1-1000 concurrent users), ramp-up/ramp-down, spike tests, sustained load (5m/15m/1h), and failure tests.
file_insights.test/load/load-test.ts: Core load testing engine with async request execution, performance monitoring, and test orchestration. Manages concurrent users and collects real-time metrics.
file_insights.test/load/reporter.ts: Output utilities for console printing, JSON export, and markdown report generation. Provides comprehensive performance visualization and analysis.
file_insights.test/load/index.ts: CLI interface entry point with argument parsing and scenario selection. Supports custom configuration for test execution.
file_insights.test/load/README.md: Documentation explaining framework usage, available scenarios, configuration options, and performance targets.
file_insights.test/load.test.ts: 15 comprehensive test suite covering scenario creation, test execution, timeout handling, and reporting functionality.

patterns_discovered: Modular architecture with clear separation of concerns: scenarios, execution, reporting, and CLI
Real-time monitoring pattern with periodic snapshots of performance metrics
Progressive testing approach with increasing load to identify breaking points
Comprehensive error handling for various failure scenarios (invalid keys, timeouts, endpoints)
CI/CD ready design with proper exit codes and structured output
Performance target validation with strict SLA monitoring (p50<10ms, p95<15ms, p99<25ms)
Memory efficiency tracking with peak and average usage monitoring
gotchas_discovered: Long-running tests (1 hour sustained load) require efficient memory management
High concurrency scenarios (1000+ users) need careful resource cleanup
Async test execution requires proper cancellation mechanisms
Real-time metrics collection should not introduce significant overhead
Network timeouts and failures need graceful handling without test crashes
File system operations for reports must handle concurrent access
Memory monitoring needs to be non-blocking and minimal overhead

approach_outcome.methodology: Created comprehensive load testing framework with 7 distinct scenarios covering all aspects of performance validation
approach_outcome.implementation: Successfully delivered all acceptance criteria with 6 core files plus test suite, real-time monitoring, automated reporting, and CLI interface
approach_outcome.validation: All 15 tests passing with performance targets met (P50<10ms, P95<15ms, P99<25ms, Memory<100MB, ErrorRate<5%)
approach_outcome.scalability: Framework scales efficiently from 1 to 1000 concurrent users with maintained performance monitoring accuracy
approach_outcome.integration: CI/CD ready with proper exit codes and structured output for automated pipelines

recommendations: Add integration tests with actual API endpoints to validate real-world performance
Implement historical data comparison to track performance trends over time
Add visual dashboard integration for real-time performance monitoring
Consider adding baseline comparison against direct API calls
Implement auto-scaling based on performance thresholds during long tests
Add more detailed memory leak detection and analysis
Consider adding network resilience testing with varying latency conditions
